## Conservation & rarity context

-   IUCN: Least Concern
-   **Rarity note:** Low-growing evergreen shrub found in scrub, sandhills, flatwoods, and coastal dunes throughout the Southeastern United States.

## Natural history notes

While the Common Yucca (Yucca filamentosa) are known to be low-growing, their showy white flowers grow large allowing the plant to reach heights of 6 feet tall. The flowers themselves are bell-shaped and droop down. They are additionally tolerant to drought. Common Yucca may also be called Adam's Needle.
